At 22:51 13/10/2005, you wrote:
>--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Ian Badcoe <ian_badcoe@y...> wrote:
> >
> > Right.  What is "this community"?  i.e. how wide does the style
> > spread.  I have written papers in the past, but they were for
> > biochemistry and you are quite right, when I read CS papers these
> > days the style always does subtly jar with me.  But are all CS
>papers
> > the same, or does the GA/NN/EC etc etc community have its own sub-
>style?
> >
>
>I forgot to answer this part.  I think "this community" is AI in
>general, but you can't go wrong just follow GA/NN/EC conventions.
>The style may extend to the broader CS community but I don't read
>enough papers outside AI to be sure.  I do know that other
>disciplines, such as in the humanities, have very different styles
>and conventions.  Even biology is different enough that I would not
>feel confident writing a biology paper for publication even if I
>knew what I was talking about.

I've read enough graphics and simulation papers to know that the AI 
style is not drastically different, whether there are any subtleties 
remains to be seen :)

The current situation with the issue is that I approached my friend 
at the U of Sheffield and asked him if he thought there would be 
anybody in his dept. who might collaborate with me on this, and he 
immediately produced a couple of good names.  He's going to sound 
them out when he gets a moment.

I'm not getting too many hopes up, I anticipate the most probable 
response will be "yes I am very interested but sadly I have no time"...

         Ian

In fifteen minutes, everybody will be in the future.
